1,if we were not in EU, would Findus etc have been buying French HORSEMEAT to mke lasagne?
2, http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IQJYymPX8Rc
3, An EU report due to be voted through the EU Parliament this November would see all marriages and civil contracts conducted in any EU country become legally binding in all other member states. Under the Berlinguer Report, a couple who are not permitted to marry in their home country could travel to another member state in order to wed, knowing that on their return home they would have to be regarded as married.
Paragraph 40 of the Report would mean that any member state would have to grant 'all social benefits and other legal effects' such as legal recognition, tax breaks and benefit entitlements to a married couple, even if such a marriage did not exist in their own legal system.
4.what can we do to make David Cameron give us the referendum that we are due
